controls.name: Account Management
controls.description: The organization manages information system accounts, including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts.
bestPractices: Use IAM to create, modify, and manage user accounts
Implement strong password policies
Regularly review access permissions
Remove unused accounts promptly

controls.name: Access Enforcement
controls.description: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
bestPractices: Use IAM policies to enforce access controls
Configure S3 bucket policies to restrict access
Implement KMS for encryption key management
Use resource-based policies where applicable

controls.name: Least Privilege
controls.description: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized access that are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks.
bestPractices: Grant minimal permissions required for job functions
Avoid using wildcard permissions (* actions)
Use IAM Permission Boundaries
Regularly review and remove unnecessary permissions

controls.name: Audit Events
controls.description: The information system audits events that are defined as auditable events in the security plan.
bestPractices: Enable CloudTrail in all regions
Log all management and data events
Send logs to a dedicated and secured S3 bucket
Configure CloudWatch alarms for specific events

controls.name: Protection of Audit Information
controls.description: The information system protects audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
bestPractices: Enable CloudTrail log file validation
Enable S3 bucket encryption for CloudTrail logs
Use KMS CMK for encryption
Enable S3 bucket versioning for CloudTrail logs
Restrict access to CloudTrail logs

controls.name: Least Functionality
controls.description: The organization configures the information system to provide only essential capabilities and prohibits or restricts the use of functions, ports, protocols, and/or services.
bestPractices: Restrict inbound and outbound traffic to only necessary ports
Use security groups and NACLs to control network access
Disable unnecessary AWS services
Regularly review and remove unused resources

controls.name: Information System Component Inventory
controls.description: The organization develops and maintains an inventory of information system components.
bestPractices: Enable AWS Config to maintain resource inventory
Use resource tagging for tracking and identification
Deploy Systems Manager for managed instances
Regularly audit resources against expected inventory

controls.name: Boundary Protection
controls.description: The information system monitors and controls communications at external boundaries and key internal boundaries.
bestPractices: Use VPCs with private subnets for sensitive resources
Configure NACLs to control traffic between subnets
Use WAF to protect web applications
Implement VPC endpoints for private AWS service access

controls.name: Cryptographic Protection
controls.description: The information system implements required cryptographic protections using FIPS-validated cryptography.
bestPractices: Use KMS for key management
Enable default encryption for S3 buckets
Use encrypted EBS volumes
Enable encryption for RDS instances
Configure TLS for data in transit
